definitions.text: dust consisting of a mixture of small coal fragments and coal dust and dirt that sifts out when coal is passed over a sieve
a noticeable deterioration in performance or quality
examples: the team went into a slump

definitions.text: a stretch of water without current or movement
examples: suddenly they were in a slack and the water was motionless

definitions.text: a soft wet area of low-lying land that sinks underfoot
the quality of being loose (not taut)
examples: he hadn't counted on the slackness of the rope

definitions.text: a cord or rope or cable that is hanging loosely
avoid responsibilities and work, be idle

examples: He slackened his pace as he got tired

definitions.text: become less in amount or intensity
examples: The rain let up after a few hours

definitions.text: cause to heat and crumble by treatment with water

examples: the old man's skin hung loose and grey

definitions.text: flowing with little speed as e.g. at the turning of the tide

examples: such lax and slipshod ways are no longer acceptable
